actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mrs. Kiggans (VA) asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, February 7, 2025, it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday, February 10, 2025, for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 226
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 205

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Casten moved to recommit to the Committee on Natural Resources.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 26.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 5. H.R. 26 â€” "To prohibit a moratorium on the use of hydraulic fracturing."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Garcia of IL to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Dr. Kevin Moore, Mount Zion Baptist Church, Huntsville, Alabama.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
